Name: Aglovale†
Works featured in: The Life of Sir Aglovale de Galis, The Once and Future King
Description: King Pellinore's eldest son

Name: Agravain†
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail, Le Morte D'Arthur, The Once and Future King
Description: Second son of King Lot and Morgause, joins Mordred's rebellion

Name: Bagdemagus†
Works featured in: Lancelot, the Knight of the Cart, 1170s
Description: Meleagant's father and ruler of Gorre

Name: Ban
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail, early 13th century;, The Once and Future King
Description: Lancelot's father

Name: Black Knight
Description: King Arthur's grandson through Tom a Lincoln. Another Black Knight is an antagonist figure

Name: Bors the Elder
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail, early 13th century; The Once and Future King
Description: Brother to King Ban, and an ally of Arthur's

Name: Bors the Younger†
Description: Son of Bors the Elder, father of Elyan the White

Name: Bruin
Works featured in: First Named in "King Arthur Meets Lady Guinevere" Howard Pyle
Description: Unknown Family, One of the original 32 Knights of the Round Table

Name: Breunor le Noir†
Description: Knight who wears his murdered father's coat, brother of Dinadan and Daniel

Name: Cador†
Works featured in: Historia Regum Britanniae, The Dream of Rhonabwy
Description: Raised Guinevere as his ward, father to Constantine III of Britain, described in some works as Arthur's cousin

Name: Caelia
Works featured in: The Faerie Queene, 1590; Tom a Lincoln part 1, 1599
Description: Tom a'Lincoln's lover, mother to the Faerie Knight

Name: Caradoc†
Works featured in: Perceval, the Story of the Grail, the Mabinogion
Description: Rebelled against Arthur when he first became king, but later supported him, sometimes two characters—Caradoc the Elder (a king) and Caradoc the Younger (a knight)

Name: Catigern
Works featured in: Historia Brittonum, 9th century; Harleian genealogies; Historia Regum Britanniae, c. 1134
Description: Son of Vortigern, fought alongside his brother Vortimer against the Saxons

Name: Claudas
Works featured in: Perlesvaus, Lancelot-Grail, Post-Vulgate Cycle, Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: A Frankish King antagonistic to Arthur, has two sons, Dorin and Claudin

Name: Claudin†
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail, Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Virtuous son of the Frankish villain Claudas, eventually becomes one of 12 knights to achieve the Holy Grail

Name: Dagonet†
Works featured in: Idylls of the King
Description: Arthur's court jester

Name: Dindrane
Description: Sister (sometimes half-sister) of Percival, plays a large part in many Holy Grail stories

Name: Durnure
Works featured in: First Named in "King Arthur Meets Lady Guinevere" Howard Pyle
Description: One of Three Sons of King Pellinore, one of the original 32 Knights of the Round Table

Name: Elaine of Garlot
Description: Daughter of Gorlois and Igraine, sister to Morgan le Fay and Morgause and a half-sister to King Arthur, wife to King Nentres.

Name: Elaine of Listenoise
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Daughter of King Pellinore, lover of Sir Miles of the Laundes

Name: Elaine the Peerless
Description: Niece of the Lord of the Fens and wife of Persides the Red of the Castle of Gazevilte

Name: Elyan the White†
Description: Son of Sir Bors and Claire, King Brandegoris' daughter, helps Lancelot rescue Guinevere and goes into exile with him

Name: Epinogres
Works featured in: First Named in "King Arthur Meets Lady Guinevere" Howard Pyle
Description: Son of King of Umberland, and brother unto Enchantress Vivien, one of the original 32 Knights of the Round Table

Name: Esclabor†
Description: Father of Palamedes, Safir, and Segwarides

Name: Gaheris†
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur, The Once and Future King
Description: Son of King Lot and Morgause, brother to Gawain, Agravaine, and Gareth, and half-brother to Mordred

Name: Gareth†
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur, Idylls of the King, The Once and Future King
Description: Also a son of Lot and Morgause, in love with Lyonesse

Name: Geneir Gwystyl
Description: One of King Arthur's knights in the Welsh Arthurian legend[1]

Name: Geraint†
Works featured in: Geraint and Enid
Description: Enid's lover

Name: Gingalain†
Other names: Guinglain, Gingalin, Gliglois, Wigalois, Le Bel Inconnu
Works featured in: Le Bel Inconnu
Description: Gawain's and Blanchemal's son

Name: Gorlois†
Works featured in: Historia Regum Britanniae
Description: Igraine's first husband before she married Uther Pendragon, father of Morgause and Morgan le Fay.

Name: Griflet†
Works featured in: Jaufré
Description: The son of Do (or Don), cousin to Sir Lucan and Sir Bedivere

Name: Hector de Maris†
Works featured in: Quest du Saint Graal, Vulgate Cycle, The Once and Future King
Description: Half-brother of Lancelot, son of King Ban and the Lady de Maris, Sir Bors and Sir Lionel are his cousins

Name: Hoel†
Works featured in: The Dream of Rhonabwy, Geraint and Enid
Description: Son of King Budic of Brittany, father to St. Tudwal

Name: Iseult of Ireland
Works featured in: Tristan and Iseult
Description: Wife of Mark of Cornwall and adulterous lover of Sir Tristan

Name: (Queen) Iseult
Works featured in: Tristan and Iseult
Description: Iseult of Ireland's mother

Name: Iseult of the White Hands
Works featured in: Tristan and Iseult
Description: Daughter of Hoel of Brittany, sister of Sir Kahedin, and wife of Tristan

Name: Josephus of Arimathea
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail cycle, Post-Vulgate Cycle, Prose Tristan, Le Morte D'Arthur
Description: Son of Joseph of Arimathea

Name: Leodegrance†
Description: Guinevere's father, King of Cameliard in what is now southwest England

Name: Lionel†
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail, early 13th century; The Once and Future King
Description: Son of King Bors of Gaunnes (or Gaul), brother of Bors the Younger

Name: Lucan†
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Servant to King Arthur, Bedivere's brother, Griflet's cousin

Name: Meirchion
Works featured in: Tristan and Iseult
Description: Father to Mark of Cornwall

Name: Morvydd
Works featured in: Welsh Triads, Culhwch and Olwen
Description: Owain's twin sister

Name: Oberon
Other names: Auberon, King of Shadows and Fairies
Description: King of the Fairies, sometimes identified as a son of Morgan le Fay

Name: Parcenet
Works featured in: The Story of King Arthur and His Knights
Description: A maid from Queen Ettarre's court who helps Sir Pelleas

Name: Pellinore†
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail, Post-Vulgate Cycle, Le Morte d'Arthur, The Once and Future King
Description: King of Listenoise, friend to Arthur, father to many

Name: Penpingion[2]
Works featured in: Culhwch ac Olwen, Geraint fab Erbin
Description: A comic character; one of the gatekeepers at Arthur's court, subservient to Glewlwyd Gafaelfawr.[2] Killed in the hunt for Twrch Trwyth.[3]

Name: (Lady) Ragnell
Description: Sir Gawain's wife, in some legends mother of Percival

Name: Safir†
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur, Prose Tristan
Description: Son to Esclabor, brother of Segwarides and Palamedes

Name: Sagramore†
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail, Post-Vulgate Cycle, Prose Tristan, Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Ubiquitous Knight of the Round Table; various stories and origins are given for him

Name: Segwarides†
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur, Prose Tristan
Description: Son of Esclabor, brother of Safir and Palamedes

Name: Tor†
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Son of King Ars, adopted by Pellinore

Name: Ywain the Bastard†
Description: Urien's illegitimate son through a seneschal, accidentally killed by Gawain

Name: (King) Cerdic of Wessex
Description: First King of Wessex

Name: (King) Cynric of Wessex
Description: Second King of Wessex, son of Cerdic

Name: Mordred†
Works featured in: Many
Description: In some literature, Arthur's illegitimate son through Morgause (or Morgan le Fay), kills and is killed by Arthur

Name: Escanor the Large
Description: Son of a giant and a witch, brother of Alienor, and uncle of Escanor the Handsome, he shared Gawain’s power by which his strength waxed and waned with the sun.

Name: (King) Constans son of Constantine
Earliest appearance: Based on the historical figure Constans
Works featured in: Historia Regum Britanniae
Description: Son of Constantine II of Britain, older brother to Uther Pendragon

Name: (King) Constantine II of Britain
Earliest appearance: Based on the historical figure Constantine
Works featured in: Historia Regum Britanniae
Description: Arthur's grandfather, father to Uther Pendragon, Constans, and Ambrosius Aurelianus

Name: Ywain†
Earliest appearance: Based on the historical figure Owain mab Urien
Works featured in: Historia Brittonum, Yvain, the Knight of the Lion
Description: Urien's son, Morvydd's brother

Name: Madoc
Works featured in: Stanzas of the Graves
Description: Son of Uther Pendragon, brother of Arthur in early Welsh tradition, father of Eliwlod

Name: Menw ap Tairgwaedd
Works featured in: Welsh Triads
Description: Enchanter, member of Arthur's retinue

Name: Llamrei
Works featured in: Culhwch and Olwen, 11th century
Description: Llamrei was a mare owned by King Arthur

Name: Mabon ap Modron
Works featured in: Welsh Triads
Description: Son of Modron, kidnapped at birth, rescued by Culhwch

Name: Culhwch
Description: Cousin of Arthur's in early Welsh legend

Name: Gawain†
Works featured in: Conte du Graal, Lancelot-Grail cycle, Prose Tristan, Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, Le Morte D'Arthur, The Once and Future King, many short Middle English romances
Description: Another son of Lot and Morgause, father of Gingalain

Name: Guinevak
Works featured in: Welsh Triads, Misfortunes of Elphin
Description: Guinevere's half-sister

Name: (Queen) Guinevere
Works featured in: Many
Description: High Queen of Britain, wife of King Arthur, famous for her affair with Lancelot

Name: Gwyn ap Nudd
Description: One of Arthur's knights. Brother of Edern ap Nudd, rival of Gwythyr ap Greidawl, lover of Creiddylad

Name: Olwen
Description: Daughter of Ysbaddaden, beloved of Culhwch

Name: Ysbaddaden
Description: A giant and antagonist

Name: Edern ap Nudd
Other names: Edern, son of Nudd, Yder, Yver, Isdernus, Knight of the Sparrowhawk
Works featured in: Erec and Enide, Geraint ac Enid, The Dream of Rhonabwy
Description: Brother of Gwyn ap Nudd, rival to Erec/Geraint, originally a hostile figure, later a member of Arthur's retinue

Name: Hueil mab Caw
Works featured in: Vita Gildae, Welsh Triads
Description: A Pictish plunderer and chieftain, killed by Arthur, brother to Saint Gildas

Name: Modron
Earliest appearance: Culhwch and Olwen, Welsh Triads, 11th century
Works featured in: Welsh Triads
Description: Mother of Mabon, in another folktale, she is the mother of Owain (Ywain) and Morvydd by Urien, Possible source for Morgan le Fay

Name: Daniel von Blumenthal†
Description: A Knight of the Round Table found in an early German offshoot of Arthurian legend

Name: Aurelius Ambrosius
Earliest appearance: De Excidio et Conquestu Britanniae c. 540s
Works featured in: Historia Brittonum c. 820
Description: Uther Pendragon's brother, High King of Britain before him

Name: Tom Thumb
Works featured in: The History of Tom Thumb, Tom Thumb, The Tragedy of Tragedies
Description: A tiny creation of Merlin, later becomes Arthur's court dwarf and an honorary knight

Name: Enide
Works featured in: Idylls of the King, Geraint and Enid
Description: Erec's wife

Name: Gornemant
Works featured in: Perceval, the Story of the Grail
Description: Percival's mentor

Name: Gringolet
Works featured in: Sir Gawain and the Green Knight
Description: Gawain's horse

Name: Lancelot†
Other names: Lancelot du Lac, Lancelot of the Lake, Launcelot
Works featured in: Lancelot, the Knight of the Cart, Lancelot-Grail, The Once and Future King, many others
Description: Son to King Ban and Elaine, most famous for his affair with Queen Guinevere, Arthur's wife, most prominent Knight of the Round Table

Name: Percival†
Works featured in: Perceval, the Story of the Grail, Lancelot-Grail, many
Description: Achiever of the Holy Grail, King Pellinore's son in some tales

Name: Morgan Tud
Description: Head physician of Arthur's court

Name: Escanor the Handsome
Description: King of the White Mountain and nephew of Escanor the large, Gawain defeated him in combat after Escanor tried to abduct Sir Girflct.

Name: Amr
Works featured in: Geraint and Enid
Description: Son of King Arthur

Name: Brutus of Britain
Description: First King of Britain, a Trojan

Name: Vortimer
Description: Son of Vortigern

Name: Constantine†
Works featured in: Historia Regum Britanniae, Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Arthur's nephew and successor to his throne, Cador's son

Name: Igraine
Works featured in: Vulgate Merlin, Le Morte d'Arthur, The Once and Future King
Description: Mother to King Arthur through an affair with Uther Pendragon, mother of Morgause and Morgan le Fay through her first husband Gorlois

Name: Lot
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur, The Once and Future King
Description: King of Lothian, father to Gawain, Agravain, Gaheris, and Gareth

Name: Lucius
Works featured in: Alliterative Morte Arthure, Le Morte d'Arthur,
Description: A fictional Roman Emperor and antagonist to Arthur

Name: Melehan
Description: Elder son of Mordred

Name: Morgause
Works featured in: The Once and Future King, many others
Description: Arthur's half-sister, wife to King Lot, mother to Gawain, Agravaine, Gaheris, and Gareth, and in some traditions, also the mother of Mordred

Name: Rience
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail, Post Vulgate Cycle, Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: King defeated by Arthur

Name: Merlin
Other names: (Welsh: Myrddin), Myrddin Emrys, Merlin Ambrosius, Merlyn
Earliest appearance: Historia Regum Britanniae, c. 1136, but derived from earlier Welsh tales
Works featured in: Many
Description: Wizard, guide to King Arthur

Name: Owain†
Works featured in: Owain, or the Lady of the Fountain
Description: Son of Urien

Name: Taliesin
Works featured in: The Welsh Triads, Story of Taliesin, Alfred, Idylls of the King
Description: Bard to King Arthur, oldest known Welsh poet

Name: Urien†
Works featured in: Welsh Triads
Description: Father of Ywain (Owain mab Urien), husband of Morgan le Fay

Name: Joseph of Arimathea
Description: First keeper of the Holy Grail in Arthurian legend

Name: Ector†
Works featured in: The Once and Future King, Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Raises Arthur according to Merlin's command, father to Sir Kay

Name: Elaine of Benoic
Works featured in: The Once and Future King
Description: Wife of King Ban and mother to Lancelot, Evaine's sister

Name: Evaine
Description: Wife of Bors the Elder, mother of Bors the Younger and Lionel, sister of Elaine of Benoic, aunt of Lancelot

Name: Galahad†
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail, Post-Vulgate Cycle, Le Morte d'Arthur, The Once and Future King
Description: Illegitimate son of Sir Lancelot and Elaine of Corbenic

Name: Galehault†
Description: Former enemy of Arthur who becomes close friends with Lancelot

Name: Lanval†
Works featured in: Sir Landevale, Sir Launfal, Sir Lambewell
Description: A knight of King Arthur's court who falls in love with a fairy

Name: Andred
Description: Cousin of Tristram

Name: Elaine of Astolat
Other names: Elaine the White, Elaine the Fair, The Lady of Shalott
Works featured in: The Lady of Shalott
Description: Daughter of Bernard of Astolat, classic Arthurian figure of unrequited love

Name: Lynette
Works featured in: Idylls of the King
Description: Seeks aid from Arthur to rescue her sister Lyonesse, Arthur sends an incognito Gareth, who she berates until he proves his worth

Name: Lyonesse
Works featured in: Idylls of the King
Description: Entrapped sister of Lynette, rescued by Gareth, whom she eventually marries

Name: Morien†
Description: Half-Moorish son of Aglovale

Name: Kay†
Earliest appearance: Pa Gur yv y porthaur, 10th century
Works featured in: Many
Description: Foster brother to Arthur, Sir Ector's son

Name: Bedivere†
Earliest appearance: Pa Gur yv y Porthaur, c. 10th century
Works featured in: Vita Cadoc, Culhwch and Olwen, Stanzas of the Graves, Welsh Triads, Historia Regum Britanniae, Le Morte d'Arthur, numerous others
Description: Returns Excalibur to The Lady of the Lake, brother to Sir Lucan

Name: Uther Pendragon
Other names: (French: Uter Pendragon), (Welsh: Wthyr Bendragon, Uthr Bendragon, Uthyr Pendraeg)
Earliest appearance: Pa Gur yv y Porthaur?, c. 10th century
Works featured in: Historia Regum Britanniae, c. 1136; Welsh Triads; The Once and Future King
Description: Arthur's father

Name: Guiron le Courtois
Works featured in: Palamedes, Guiron Compilation
Description: Companion of Meliodas

Name: Feirefiz†
Description: Half-brother to Percival

Name: Lohengrin
Works featured in: Parzival, Lohengrin, Lorengel, Richard Wagner's Lohengrin
Description: A knight of the Holy Grail, son of Percival

Name: Elaine of Corbenic
Earliest appearance: Perceval, the Story of the Grail c. 1181
Works featured in: The Once and Future King; Perceval le Gallois, 1978
Description: Daughter of the Fisher King, mother of Galahad by Lancelot

Name: Blanchefleur
Earliest appearance: Perceval, the Story of the Grail, c. 1181
Description: Percival's wife, niece to Gornemant

Name: Fisher King, The
Earliest appearance: Perceval, the Story of the Grail, c. 1181
Works featured in: Queste del Saint Graal, c. 1220; Prose Tristan, c. 1230, The Once and Future King
Description: Guardian of the Holy Grail, Father of Elaine of Corbenic

Name: Orgeluse
Earliest appearance: Perceval, the Story of the Grail, c. 1181
Description: A wife of Gawain

Name: Red Knight
Earliest appearance: Perceval, the Story of the Grail, c. 1181
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Appears in many tales, usually as an antagonist

Name: Questing Beast
Works featured in: Gerbert's Continuation of Perceval, the Story of the Grail, Post Vulgate Suite du Merlin, Prose Tristan, Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: A strange beast quested after by many knights associated with Pellinore and Palamedes

Name: Mark of Cornwall
Earliest appearance: Possibly based on a historical figure from the 6th century
Works featured in: Post-Vulgate Cycle, Prose Tristan, Le Morte d'Arthur, Palamedes, The Once and Future King
Description: Tristan's uncle, husband to Iseult

Name: Accolon
Description: Morgan le Fay's love

Name: Balan
Works featured in: Post-Vulgate Cycle, Le Morte D'Arthur
Description: Brother to Balin

Name: Balin
Other names: Sir Balin le Savage, Knight with Two Swords
Works featured in: Post-Vulgate Cycle, Le Morte D'Arthur
Description: Brother to Balan, kills the Lady of the Lake and strikes the Dolorous Stroke

Name: Pelleas†
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur, Idylls of the King
Description: A Knight of the Round table in love with Ettarre, later lover of Nimue

Name: Vortigern
Earliest appearance: Probably a historical figure, The Ecclesiastical History of the English People, 721
Description: King of Britain whose decisions assisted the Anglo-Saxon invasion of Britain

Name: Meliodas
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Father to Tristan, Tristan's father was named Rivalen in earlier versions

Name: Dinadan†
Works featured in: Prose Tristan, Le Morte D'Arthur
Description: Son of Sir Brunor the Senior

Name: Palamedes†
Works featured in: The Once and Future King
Description: Saracen Knight of the Round Table

Name: Lamorak†
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail Cycle, The Once and Future King
Description: Son of King Pellinore, brother to Tor, Aglovale, Percival, and Dindrane, lover of Morgause

Name: Kahedin
Other names: Kahadin, Kahedrin, Kehenis, Kehidius, possibly (Welsh: Kae Hir)
Works featured in: Prose Tristan, Le Morte D'Arthur
Description: Brother to Iseult, son of King Hoel, had an affair with Brangaine

Name: Tristan†
Other names: (Latin/Brythonic: Drustanus), (Welsh: Drystan), (Portuguese: Tristão), (Spanish: Tristán), Tristran, Tristram
Works featured in: Roman de Tristan, the two "Folies Tristans", "Chevrefeuil", Prose Tristan, Post-Vulgate Cycle, Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Son of Blancheflor and Rivalen (or Meliodas), Iseult's lover

Name: Segurant
Earliest appearance: Segurant, the Knight of the Dragon, late 13th century.
Works featured in: Prophecies of Merlin
Description: Knight of the Isle of Not-Knowing, son of Hector the Brown, Dragon slayer,

Name: Green Knight, The
Earliest appearance: Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, 1300s
Works featured in: The Greene Knight, King Arthur and King Cornwall
Description: A knight enchanted by Morgan le Fay in order to test Gawain

Name: Hengest
Earliest appearance: The Ecclesiastical History of the English People, 721
Works featured in: Historia Regum Britanniae
Description: An Anglo-Saxon king killed by Uther Pendragon, Horsa's brother

Name: Horsa
Earliest appearance: The Ecclesiastical History of the English People, 721
Works featured in: Anglo-Saxon Chronicle
Description: Brother to Hengest

Name: Manawydan fab Llyr
Works featured in: Culhwch and Olwen (circa 1100)
Description: Originally a British god; appeared as a knight of Arthur's in Culhwch and Olwen

Name: Faerie Knight, The
Description: Illegitimate son of Tom a'Lincoln and Caelia, the Faerie Queen, half brother to the Black Knight

Name: Tom a Lincoln†
Earliest appearance: Tom a Lincoln part 1, 1599; possibly mentioned in Robert Greene's Farewell to Folly, 1591
Description: Illegitimate son of King Arthur through Angelica

Name: Brangaine
Works featured in: Tristan poems, Post-Vulgate Cycle, Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Handmaid to Iseult

Name: Morholt†
Works featured in: Tristan poems, Prose Tristan, Post-Vulgate Cycle, Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Irish knight, rival of Tristan, uncle of Iseult

Name: Maleagant†
Earliest appearance: Unclear, a similar character named "Melwas" appears in the 12th century Life of Gildas
Works featured in: Lancelot-Grail, Post-Vulgate Cycle, Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Abductor of Guinevere

Name: Lady of the Lake
Earliest appearance: Unclear; a water fay is first mentioned as Lancelot's foster mother in Lancelot, the Knight of the Cart, 1170s
Works featured in: Many
Description: There are several related characters called the Lady of the Lake—their actions include giving Arthur his sword Excalibur, raising Lancelot and his cousins as foster children, enchanting Merlin, and taking the dying king to Avalon

Name: Erec†
Earliest appearance: Unclear; first literary appearance as Erec in Erec and Enide, c. 1170
Works featured in: see Geraint and Enid
Description: Son of King Lac and a Knight of the Round Table

Name: Morgan le Fay
Earliest appearance: Unclear; first mention as Morgan in Vita Merlini, c. 1150
Works featured in: Many
Description: Sorceress, half-sister and sometime antagonist of Arthur, and (in some traditions) mother of Mordred

Name: Galeschin†
Description: Son of Elaine of Garlot and King Nentres, nephew of Arthur

Name: Eliwlod
Description: Nephew to Arthur, son of Madoc, Uther Pendragon's son

Name: Loholt
Other names: Possibly Llacheu (similar character in Welsh sources)
Works featured in: Perlesvaus, Vulgate Cycle (as Loholt)
Description: Illegitimate son of Arthur

Name: (King) Arthur†
Works featured in: Many
Description: High King of Britain, ruler of Logres and lord of Camelot

Name: Calogrenant†
Earliest appearance: Yvain, the Knight of the Lion, 1170s
Works featured in: Le Morte d'Arthur
Description: Cousin to Sir Ywain

Name: Esclados
Earliest appearance: Yvain, the Knight of the Lion, 1170s
Description: Defended a magical fountain in the Forest of Broceliande, married to Laudine

Name: Laudine
Earliest appearance: Yvain, the Knight of the Lion, 1170s
Works featured in: Owain, or the Lady of the Fountain, Iwein
Description: Sir Ywain's wife

Name: Lunete
Earliest appearance: Yvain, the Knight of the Lion, 1170s
Description: Handmaiden and advisor to Laudine
